lender.name: Jennifer
lender.loan_because: I believe in supporting what I'd like to see more of, rather than fighting a war against something I don't want to see. So rather than fighting "the war against poverty" and "the war against gender inequality," I'd rather use my funds to support strong women becoming financially successful. I truly believe that for every person who becomes successful, it gets a little easier for the rest of us to be inspired to do so. People used to say that running the four-minute mile was impossible, until one person did it.
lender.occupational_info: I am an American, living in a small farming town in Japan where I teach English to Japanese junior high school and elementary students.

lender.name: Meredith-Wilston Vet
lender.loan_because: Having established my own small business (a vet surgery) I feel very blessed that I could easily obtain a loan from the bank to do this. Many people in poorer countries do not have this luxury. My staff and I would like to help these people reach their own business goals,especially those working with animals /livestock. Hopefully we can make a difference in their lives, their families lives and their community as a whole. Improving their farming practices by providing funds for livestock health will also improve the lives of the animals they own.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a small inner city veterinary surgery with 6 other full time staff(vets and nurses). We mainly look after the health of dogs and cats, but also treat wildlife, birds and reptiles. As a business we believe in supporting both the local community ,as well as the wider community( eg kiva) with our business profits. Follow my puppy's blog on facebook-> http://www.facebook.com/people/Mimi-La-Chien/100000325463757

lender.name: Christian
lender.loan_because: I believe that posterity will not forgive me if I do not serve the poor in my locality. I am so passionate about the poor in the Niger Delta in Nigeria.the poor and excluded are so many in our country and my contribution will add up in eradicating poverty
lender.occupational_info: I started lending to the poor women on 6.08.07 and what surprises me is how an average of $134 has positively affected so many of our women. with this I went to Grameen Bank/ Grameen Trust International 56th Dialogue Program in 2009 to learn in the field how they do it in Bangladesh. My work has since improved and enlarged as we reach more women using the adjusted replication methodology of the Grameen Bank

lender.name: Patricia KS

lender.occupational_info: I do research on breastfeeding, and teach at a university.
